title: 1966–67 NK Dinamo Zagreb season
text:
The 1966–67 season was <a href="NK%20Dinamo%20Zagreb">Dinamo Zagreb</a>'s 21st season in the <a href="Yugoslav%20First%20League">Yugoslav First League</a>. It was the second season that the league was played in a 30-round format after it had been expanded from 15 to 16 clubs in the <a href="1965%E2%80%9366%20Yugoslav%20First%20League">1965–66 season</a>.
Dinamo finished runners-up in the <a href="1966%E2%80%9367%20Yugoslav%20First%20League">league</a>, with two points behind champions <a href="FK%20Sarajevo">FK Sarajevo</a>. They were also knocked out in the 1967–68 <a href="Yugoslav%20Cup">Yugoslav Cup</a> by the same team, losing 1–0 in the Round of 16. However, it proved to be the club's most successful season in history in terms of <a href="NK%20Dinamo%20Zagreb%20in%20Europe">European competitions</a>, as they won the <a href="1966%E2%80%9367%20Inter-Cities%20Fairs%20Cup">1966–67 Inter-Cities Fairs Cup</a>, beating England's <a href="Leeds%20United%20F.C.">Leeds United</a> in the <a href="1967%20Inter-Cities%20Fairs%20Cup%20Final">two-legged final</a> 2–0 on aggregate.
This was Dinamo's second final in the competition, having lost the <a href="1963%20Inter-Cities%20Fairs%20Cup%20Final">1963 final</a> to Spanish side <a href="Valencia%20CF">Valencia</a> four years earlier. It was also the first and only European trophy won by a <a href="SFR%20Yugoslavia">Yugoslav</a> club until <a href="Red%20Star%20Belgrade">Red Star Belgrade</a>'s triumph in the <a href="1990%E2%80%9391%20European%20Cup">1990–91 European Cup</a> 24 years later.
<a href="Slaven%20Zambata">Slaven Zambata</a> was the club's top league scorer with 13 goals in 23 matches, and goalkeeper <a href="Marijan%20Brn%C4%8Di%C4%87">Marijan Brnčić</a> was the only player who appeared in all 30 league matches for the Blues. In addition, Zambata also scored 6 goals in the Inter-Cities Fairs Cup, which meant he shared second place in the competition's goalscoring table (along with Burnley's <a href="Andy%20Lochhead">Andy Lochhead</a> and Eintracht Frankfurt's Oskar Lotz) behind <a href="Fl%C3%B3ri%C3%A1n%20Albert%2C%20Sr.">Flórián Albert</a> of <a href="Ferencv%C3%A1rosi%20TC">Ferencváros</a>.
Players.
Squad.
The following is the full list of players who appeared in league matches for Dinamo in the 1966–67 season. Although <a href="Marijan%20%C4%8Cer%C4%8Dek">Marijan Čerček</a> did not appear in any of the 1966–67 league matches, he did appear for Dinamo in the Inter-Cities Fairs Cup.
Statistics.
The following table lists appearances and goals of all players who represented Dinamo in the 1966–67 season. Only league matches and goals are taken into account.
